Bitcoin lost the opportunity to become a true currency!

But history can't be rewritten. BTC scaling failed & congestion began before 2016 halving . By 2020 halving, no. of trans & the fee remained almost unchanged. Temporarily price increase is only because of the congestion.

2012-2016, BTC trans increased tenfold & trans fee was 0.2-0.3 BTC. If BTC scaling was smooth, trans could up another tenfold, with average block size of 10M & a fee of 2-3 BTC, close to 40-50% of block reward. The fee would exceed block reward&maintain healthy operation of BTC.

There's no accurate statistics for BTC network hashrate because it's calculated based on blocks and difficulty in past time. But block mining is a probability event, which has variance with expected value. That's why it's meaningless to calculate it, especially on daily basis.
Market tends to be ineffective in the short term, so fallacies are widely spread and accepted. But a long-term market is usually extremely efficient. However, efficiency is costly.

With the larger blocksize, BCH is in the second position among hard forks of BTC,at lowest price & with high investment value. Now the market is recovering, the topic of increasing block size will be brought up when BTC network is crowding, which brings a full opportunity to BCH.
